metadata.title: CVE-2018-7454 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference in XFAForm::scanFields in XFAForm.cc in xpdf4.00 allows attackers to launch denial of service via a specific pdf file,as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6').
libextractor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
